snippet.title: Melbourne weather: Winter storm to hit city
snippet.content:
An Antarctic blast has delivered lots of fresh snow to Falls Creek and 10-month-old Cruz Beaton is loving it.
Aneeka Simonis and Cassie Zervos
Share
MELBURNIANS should brace for another winter storm with rain and hail forecast to hit the city later today. The city shivered through a miserable winter weekend, but it was good news for the snow fields with the freezing conditions dumping more than half a metre of snow in alpine areas. Falls Creek and Hotham had between 70-80cm of snow over the last two days. Storms are expected in some parts of the state late this afternoon. In Melbourne rain is predicted early in the morning before clearing with a top of just 12C. The city could also see hail and thunder. Winds are expected to reach up to 30km/h. Damaging winds with peak gusts of up to 100km/h are also predicted, which may affect Mt Buller, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Snow has been sighted in areas across regional Victoria including Gordon and Trentham.
